Examples: Úna Bhan, She moved through the fair

Features: About loss, death, eviction, of friend, longing for better times

Examples: Whiskey in the jar, Preab san Ól, Níl sé ‘na Lá

Features: For working in the fields, kitchen, forge, has steady rhythm to match the work
Examples: Ding dong Dédero, Amhrán na Cuiginne

Features: Sorrowful, grief, focus on religious topics, usually slow, not common due to penal laws
Examples: Wexford Carol, Caoineadh na dTrí Mhuire
The Holy Ground, An Poc ar Buille

Features: For small children, bouncy rhythm, repeats words and melody
Ashling – dream/visions song, Rebel/nationalist and famine songs
Examples: Boolavogue, Four Green Fields, Táimse im’ Chodladh

Features: Alternates between English and Irish, Some patriotic in the Irish parts
Examples: Siúil a Rúin, One day for Recreation

Features: A narrative lyric song, often on political or social life, love, alcohol, emigration, the sea
Examples: The Foggy Dew, Finnegan’s Wake, The Croppy Boy, The Fields of Athenry

Features: Composed by Irish in English language, many are ballads as well
Examples: The Last Rose of Summer, The Mountains of Mourne
